hero.title: Queer Swing Dance Exchange Zürich
hero.tagline: Subscribe for updates and early bird access!

whatIsQSXZ.title: What is QSXZ?
whatIsQSXZ.content: A special event bringing together the Zurich Swing Dance scene and the beautiful diversity of the queer community. Dance, connect, and experience the local scene — while celebrating inclusion and diversity at every level.

whatToExpect.title: What to Expect
whatToExpect.content: No formal classes — relaxed workshops, daytime activities linked to queer spaces, and lots of dancing & community. Join the Pride parade with us on June 20!

venue.title: The Venue
venue.content: Flow60 — Two rooms, terrace, fully accessible (elevator, step-free, gender-neutral bathrooms)

pride.title: Pride Weekend
pride.content: QSXZ takes place during Zürich Pride weekend — join us marching in the parade on Saturday! This is more than a dance event; it's a celebration of queer joy, visibility, and community.

artists.title: Music & Performers
artists.content: Live swing bands, talented DJs, and spectacular drag performances. We're bringing together artists who embody the spirit of queer celebration and swing dance.

city.title: Discover Zürich
city.content: A beautiful, queer-friendly city with stunning lake views, vibrant nightlife, and excellent public transport. Join our city tours and discover corners of Zürich you might not otherwise see — from hidden queer spaces to swing dance history.

codeOfConduct.title: Code of Conduct
points: No discrimination based on age, origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, appearance, dance level, or any other characteristics.
Only yes means yes. Ask rather than assume.
Declining an invitation to dance is completely fine — don't take it personally.
Communicate your needs openly and respectfully — don't make your dance partners guess.
All imaginable dance constellations, such as follower & leader, switching, stealing, or solo dancing are welcome. Make sure at the beginning that everyone involved feels comfortable with it.
Be aware of the space around you and dance considerately.
Ask for permission before taking photos or recording videos.
Keep yourself fresh with spare shirts, deodorant, gum, and similar items.
Contact the care team if you notice an incident or need support.
Practice responsible use of alcohol and drugs.

planningNotes.title: Planning Notes (Internal)
planningNotes.note3: On Friday, we want to have a nice meetup where people get to know each other in a small setting. A Taster for people who want to try switch dancing? And a Café Crawl (Swiss thingy) where people also discuss queer topics? Auf dem Vorplatz, we should have a thingy on what it means to be queer, in general, but also, in the context of Lindy Hop. People may realize that they, too, are actually queer :)
planningNotes.note4: On Saturday, it should be possible to have a nice outdoor activity. Some sort of tour of Zurich, either from a queer perspective, or from a swing dance perspective, which could be cool. But also, the meetup the day before should be sufficient. Zürich is beautiful in summer, maybe go swimming? But then not everyone does that. It could be nice to have a drag brunch on Saturday, that would be cool, parallel with the Pride. And in the afternoon, a drag workshop. So we offer a brunch from 11:00 to 13:00, a drag brunch, and from 14:00 to 16:00, a drag workshop. Parallel, we have the tours, and probably some other activities. And we hold a masterclass for advanced dancers on switch dancing. Or it may make sense to reduce it to a 1 hour workshop :) And the party starts at like 20:00 then.
